channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Cars were pivotal as U.S. industrial output jumped 0.7% in February
Wiz founders’ bold bet: Rejecting Google’s original offer leads to $32 billion buyout deal—and $9 billion in extra cash
item.description: If closed, the-cash Wiz transaction will become Google’s most expensive acquisition in the company’s 25-year history.

item.title: Fund managers report largest slide ever in allocation to U.S. stocks
U.S. housing starts and building permits outpaced forecasts in February
Top psychologist Adam Grant says it’s not on women to close the pay gap—It’s time for employers to step up
item.description: Only 36% of women feel comfortable asking for a raise, according to new data from Glassdoor.

item.title: Economic calendar: Housing starts, import prices today; tomorrow, a Fed decision
Did Trump’s tariff policy play a part as U.S. import prices jumped in February?
Clean technology will prevail despite policy uncertainty today—so deploy, baby, deploy
item.description: Over three-quarters of CFOs are increasing or maintaining sustainability investments in 2025.

item.title: Blockchain payments company Halliday raises $20 million from Andreessen Horowitz
item.description: The company will use the money to accelerate the launch of their flagship product.

item.title: This leader is making AI accessible across the world’s languages
item.description: Sara Hooker runs the nonprofit Cohere for AI.
